meanings.definition: To tease or make fun of someone in a playful manner.
meanings.sent1: During recess, the kids would chiack each other about their favorite sports teams.
meanings.sent2: She would always chiack her brother about his messy room, but it was all in good fun.
meanings.sent3: The siblings would chiack each other about who could finish their chores faster.
meanings.sent4: His friends would chiack him for always being the last one to arrive at the party.
meanings.sent5: The students would chiack the teacher when she made a funny mistake.

meanings.definition: A playful or teasing remark or comment.
meanings.sent1: She couldn't help but giggle at the chiack her friends made about her new haircut.
meanings.sent2: The chiack about his fashion sense was all in good fun and never meant to be hurtful.
meanings.sent3: The chiack from her classmates always brought a smile to her face.
meanings.sent4: His witty chiack always lightened the mood during tense moments.
meanings.sent5: The playful chiack between the siblings made their bond even stronger.
